briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon. Welcome to the climate briefing for January 24, 2026.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Climate Crisis: Extreme Weather Events Becoming a Reality
sections.content: The recent record-breaking cold snap in the United States has reignited debates about climate change [5]. While former President Donald Trump questioned the existence of global warming in the context of winter storms [24, 36, 39, 48], scientists explain that climate change can actually intensify such winter storms [5, 25, 26, 27]. Experts in Virginia also described the strengthening of winter storms as 'unnatural' [27]. Concurrently, in Java, Indonesia, landslides and floods caused by heavy rainfall resulted in 7 deaths and 82 missing persons [23], demonstrating how extreme weather events are leading to casualties worldwide. These incidents clearly show that climate change is no longer a distant future concern but a reality directly impacting our lives.

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Changes in Domestic Climate Awareness and Policy Efforts
sections.content: Domestically, public awareness of climate change is significantly increasing. A survey indicates that over 8 out of 10 residents in Chungcheongbuk-do perceive climate change as serious [1, 2, 4, 11, 19], and over 7 out of 10 show interest in the climate crisis [9, 10, 12, 13]. This represents a 14.6% increase from the previous year, suggesting a deepening awareness of the climate crisis [9]. This heightened interest has translated into policy demands; at a public hearing for Gwangju and Jeonnam citizens, a call was made for the systematic implementation of carbon neutrality policies at the regional level [17]. Furthermore, local communities are actively engaging in climate change response efforts, such as Cheongju City expanding support for eco-friendly vehicles [18].

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Corporate Climate Action and Carbon Neutrality Initiatives
sections.content: Corporate efforts to address climate change are being recognized for their achievements through international evaluations. SK ecoplant earned a leadership A- rating in the CDP (Carbon Disclosure Project) climate change response assessment, demonstrating advanced carbon management performance [3, 7, 8, 14]. Ecolab and the international company Sofidel also maintained or achieved 'A' and A- ratings, respectively, in CDP's water security, climate change, and forests categories [6, 38], emphasizing the importance of sustainable management. Domestically, Dongseo Power is engaging in carbon neutrality and environmental conservation activities with 30,000 Ulsan citizens [15]. At the Davos Forum, corporate leaders showed efforts to leverage AI and carbon neutrality as key factors for strengthening global market competitiveness [16]. Furthermore, public sector investment is also active, with Maine securing $7.5 million for coastal improvements in response to climate change concerns [28, 34].

sections.title: âš ï¸ Challenges in Global Climate Policy and Deepening Threats
sections.content: Despite efforts to address climate change, various challenges and warnings continue globally. The observation at the Davos Forum that the climate change agenda was pushed down in priority by other pressing issues [30] suggests a potential wavering in the international community's commitment to tackling the climate crisis. In the United States, instances of signs explaining the impacts of climate change being removed under directives from the Trump administration [35] have raised concerns about access to climate change information. Furthermore, a new MIT climate model predicts dangerous levels of global warming despite a surge in renewable energy use [40], issuing a serious warning that current efforts may not be sufficient. Additionally, an analysis indicating that ocean damage doubles the true economic cost of climate change [37] suggests that the economic repercussions of the climate crisis could be far greater than anticipated. These situations, coupled with reports that the Winter Olympics face an existential threat due to climate change [31], reaffirm the severe impact of the climate crisis across various aspects of our lives.

sections.title: âš¡ Accelerating Renewable Energy Transition and Current Challenges
sections.content: The transition to renewable energy is a core trend in climate change response, drawing attention both domestically and internationally. In South Korea, renewable energy is beginning to be utilized as a rapid response resource in the power grid [21], further increasing its importance. Driven by a positive atmosphere in the solar power market, the stock price of S-Energy has significantly risen [22], indicating vitality in the renewable energy industry. However, there is also a critique that for renewable energy expansion policies to successfully take root, the gap with power system designs capable of accommodating them must be addressed [20]. Internationally, discussions are actively taking place on innovative approaches beyond renewable energy technology, such as the EU being advised to explore the use of quantum technology for climate change solutions [47]. While these efforts represent significant progress towards a sustainable energy future, they also highlight the remaining technical and policy challenges for a stable energy transition.

briefing.closing: Considering the increased public awareness of climate change, the proactive responses from corporations, and the extreme weather phenomena and policy challenges discussed in today's briefing, it is imperative to remember that responding to the climate crisis remains our society's top priority. This concludes today's climate briefing.

articles.title: 7 Dead, 82 Missing in Landslide on Indonesia's Java Island
articles.original_title: ì¸ë„ë„¤ì‹œì•„ ìë°”ì„¬ì—ì„œ ì‚°ì‚¬íƒœë¡œ 7ëª… ìˆ¨ì§€ê³  82ëª… ì‹¤ì¢…
articles.description: On the 23rd (local time), people were observed navigating floodwaters by motorcycle in Tangerang, Banten province, Java Island, Indonesia. A landslide, triggered by heavy rainfall on Indonesia's Java Island, has claimed 7 lives and left 82 people missing. According to reports from Reuters and Indonesian media Kompas.com, among others, the landslide occurred around 3 AM on the 24th (local time) in West Bandung, West Java province, following torrential rain. Abdul Muhari...

summary.phenomenon: On October 24th (local time), a landslide triggered by heavy rainfall occurred in West Bandung, West Java province, Indonesia, leading to 7 fatalities and 82 missing persons. Prior to this, on October 23rd (local time), individuals were observed navigating floodwaters by motorcycle in Tangerang, Banten province, Java Island.
summary.cause: This landslide was caused by heavy rainfall.
